title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 703.8 - Appeal
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 703.8 - Appeal

State Regulations
(a) Any person
denied access to a record or denied a request to amend or correct a record or
personal information may, within 30 business days of such appeal, appeal in
writing to the Commissioner of Labor, Building 12, State Campus, Albany, NY
12240. The appeal shall contain a copy of the ruling appealed from. (b) Within seven business days of an appeal
of a denial of access, or within 30 business days of an appeal concerning a
denial of a request for correction or amendment, the Commissioner of Labor
shall: (1)
provide access to or correct or
amend the record or personal information; or
(2)
explain in writing the reasons for denial
and inform the data subject of the right to seek judicial review of such
determination. (c) The
department shall immediately forward to the Committee on Open Government a copy
of any appeal made pursuant to this section upon receipt and a copy of the
determination thereof. Notes

703.8

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
